candidates.title: New hooks for libafl_qemu
candidates.body: The new hook system will allow multiple generation hooks (translation time). This will open the window to generation hooks that analyze the code and insert generic hooks to single instruction, for instance for call stack tracking.

candidates.title: Drop the build_id depedency and move to bolts
FeedbackState as metadata
candidates.body: experimental PR to have generic metadata and so allow to have feedback states as meta

candidates.title: Backtrace in libafl::Error
candidates.body:
#571 

errors_backtrace is the feature to use it, disabled by default

candidates.title: Sender id fix
candidates.body:
After the first restart, the sender was no longer set.
This PR re-reads the correct sender from the initialized page.
The sender data is now redundant in an env and the page, I guess this could be cleaned up further in the future.

candidates.title: Weighted corpus entry selection
candidates.body:
still need to change it a bit, but I want to put it into CI
from afl++ https://github.com/AFLplusplus/AFLplusplus/blob/stable/src/afl-fuzz-queue.c#L70

### Changes
- new `WeightedScheduler` and `WeightedScheduleMetadata`
-  Move `PowerScheduleMetadata` and `PowerSchedule` to schedulers/powersched.rs

candidates.title: CorpusScheduler -> Scheduler and move them to the schedulers folder
Dump Control Flow Graph in AFLCoverage LLVM Pass
candidates.body:
I am trying to implement PANGOLIN, AFLGo, DigFuzz, etc. in LibAFL, which all needs control flow graph info. This PR adds code to AFLCoverage pass to dump the CFG into a readable file and to libafl_cc to parse such file. 

For libpng, such dump file is ~700KB and parsing it takes <0.1s.
